column3: No society can surely be flourishing and happy, of which the far greater part of the members are poor and miserable.
If someone is gay and he searches for the Lord and has good will, who am I to judge? We shouldn't marginalise people for this. They must be integrated into society.
It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.
Having soon discovered to be great, I must appear so, and therefore studiously avoided mixing in society, and wrapped myself in mystery, devoting my time to fasting and prayer.

Genocide is not just a murderous madness; it is, more deeply, a politics that promises a utopia beyond politics - one people, one land, one truth, the end of difference. Since genocide is a form of political utopia, it remains an enduring temptation in any multiethnic and multicultural society in crisis.
We need society, and we need solitude also, as we need summer and winter, day and night, exercise and rest.

If the same punishment is prescribed for two crimes that injure society in different degrees, then men will face no stronger deterrent from committing the greater crime if they find it in their advantage to do so.
Ethnic diversity adds richness to a society.
Journalism is about results. It's about affecting your community or your society in the most progressive way.
Without culture, and the relative freedom it implies, society, even when perfect, is but a jungle. This is why any authentic creation is a gift to the future.

AIDS is not just God's punishment for homosexuals; it is God's punishment for the society that tolerates homosexuals.

I don't think homosexuality is a choice. Society forces you to think it's a choice, but in fact, it's in one's nature. The choice is whether one expresses one's nature truthfully or spends the rest of one's life lying about it.

One of the main lessons I have learned during my five years as Secretary-General is that broad partnerships are the key to solving broad challenges. When governments, the United Nations, businesses, philanthropies and civil society work hand-in-hand, we can achieve great things.
The proletarian woman fights hand in hand with the man of her class against capitalist society.
If you have to put someone on a pedestal, put teachers. They are society's heroes.
The objective of a terrorist is to create political change in the society he targets.
The place of chess in the society is closely related to the attitude of young people towards our game.
A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.

The society which scorns excellence in plumbing as a humble activity and tolerates shoddiness in philosophy because it is an exalted activity will have neither good plumbing nor good philosophy: neither its pipes nor its theories will hold water.

I know of no safe depository of the ultimate powers of the society but the people themselves; and if we think them not enlightened enough to exercise their control with a wholesome discretion, the remedy is not to take it from them but to inform their discretion.
Men and women must be educated, in a great degree, by the opinions and manners of the society they live in.
The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.

It is change, continuing change, inevitable change, that is the dominant factor in society today. No sensible decision can be made any longer without taking into account not only the world as it is, but the world as it will be.
Civilization is the progress toward a society of privacy. The savage's whole existence is public, ruled by the laws of his tribe. Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.
